result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Jahgui Arnold Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Judge Richards for HWC, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Kenneth Jahgui Arnold Olson appeared from jail. Case called at 10:37 a.m. Atty Andrea makes statement. Willing to take states offer. ADA Nieskes in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 in 15CM147. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE GUILTY of Ct 1 in 15CM147. ADA Nieskes gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Andrea makes arguement.  hml
Crt orders:
- 30 day jail sentence. Credit for 27 days. 
- Court costs of $443.00. Needs payment plan.
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
Pre-trial conference on April 15, 2015 at 10:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Saydie T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO; Proctor for HWC, RPR; Erin Drost, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Kenneth Jahgui Arnold Olson appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Defendant is on a PO hold.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 10:15 am.
